level 1.Description: Gender-sensitive electrification planning implements building standards that promote gender equality in energy access and usage.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning funds renewable energy projects that aim to provide clean and sustainable energy to communities.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning focuses on improving energy access for marginalized and underserved communities, particularly women and girls.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning is implemented in rural areas to address the energy needs of rural communities, with a focus on gender equality.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning partners with local NGOs to ensure community engagement and participation in energy planning and implementation.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning contributes to the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 7: Affordable and Clean Energy.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy efficiency.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning targets the reduction of energy poverty by ensuring equitable access to affordable and reliable energy services.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets employ renewable energy technologies to diversify the energy mix and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: climate change scenario analysis

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

subelement_relations.Description: Gender analysis is an essential component of gender-sensitive electrification planning. It involves assessing the different needs, priorities, and roles of women, men, and gender-diverse individuals in relation to energy access and electrification. This analysis helps identify gender-specific barriers and opportunities in the planning process.

Electrification planning is a key aspect of gender-sensitive electrification planning. It involves the development of strategies, policies, and actions to ensure equitable and sustainable access to electricity for all, taking into account the specific needs and priorities of different gender groups.

Gender mainstreaming is an important principle in gender-sensitive electrification planning. It involves integrating gender perspectives and considerations into all stages of the planning process, from data collection and analysis to policy development and implementation. This ensures that gender equality and women's empowerment are central to the electrification agenda.

Gender-responsive policies are crucial in gender-sensitive electrification planning. These policies aim to address the specific needs and priorities of women, men, and gender-diverse individuals in relation to energy access and electrification. They promote gender equality, social inclusion, and sustainable development in the energy sector.

Gender-sensitive data collection is a foundational element of gender-sensitive electrification planning. It involves gathering sex-disaggregated data and other gender-related information to understand the different energy needs, preferences, and behaviors of women, men, and gender-diverse individuals. This data helps inform evidence-based decision-making and targeted interventions.
